;"We are all in the same life class and live under the same roof. Even those who don't like to talk will start talking after a long time. They have their own little secrets. If you talk to her every day, she will naturally come to you."

;

;She told me about her classmates with her fingers: Xiaoxing is generous and does not hold grudges; Jing Wen She likes reading and playing the piano; He Man is cheerful and has a good personality...

;

;"Did you just say that she loves to cry?"

;

;"Hey, as soon as she saw me crying, she put herself out again Hold back your tears and comfort me."

;

;We were happy together. But she became serious: "Actually, people of our age are saving face. We don't want to appear weak, we want to be strong. Then we have to let them (; Classmates;) slowly accept the world."

;

;Ji Guoer, who seems to be proactive, considerate to others, and able to point out other people's problems, can also be rude in the eyes of teachers and easily loses the boundaries of expression. . Xiang Guoyue said that adolescent children often show the characteristics of hedgehogs. The "ugly duckling" students' personal will may have been suppressed in their original schools and families, and this will be reflected when they get here. Li Guihong, who has joined the school since 2011, originally felt that the children were "unruly" and would always use prank-like methods to announce their presence. "School Zhan said that children should use a magnifying glass to see their strengths and reading glasses to see their weaknesses. So I also learned to appreciate them."

;

;"In 'The Ugly Duckling', if you are talkative, you will be allowed to receive new classmates. If you can play the piano, try your best to play it; if you write a good article, it will be posted. We have a C poet who wrote an article about love and an article about life. Everyone can admire him... whether it is a theatrical performance or In the speech contest, the school requires everyone to appear on the stage, and they have to go on stage to do soy sauce. I will applaud you no matter what the performance is." Ji Guoer's words poured out like beans from a bag.

;

;"Yes, there is Xiaoying." Long Jinying, a life teacher who graduated from the police academy, has just turned 20, and her long hair cannot stop her heroic spirit. During the few days of the interview, she was either cleaning up the potted plants she bought, or using a saw to cut wood strips and build flower stands. "Xiaoying is so awesome. She helps you prepare medicines when you are sick, decorate and paint walls, and dance Dai dance during the Torch Festival. She can do it all! She is very good at dealing with children who have emotional outbursts and will let you go for a walk. She will talk to you again when you calm down. ." Xiaoying in the minds of Ji Guoer and He Man seems to be the common "idol" of the girls.

;

;;

;

;Students having lunch;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/picture);

;

;" Send them to the ugly old duck"

;

;But capable people like Xiaoying and Xiang Guoyue also have times when they are not very motivated.

;

;"Like Pu Pu and Tian Lan, although their parents have had disputes with them, they can generally calm down, accept their children's current situation, and cooperate with the school." Xiang Guoyue pointed out that the most difficult thing is The problem is that some parents send their children here because they hope that "you will educate their children in their own way, only caring about the results and not caring about what is behind them"; or they are not aware of their own problems and find it difficult to communicate; what's more, He almost doesn't care about his children.

;

;“Children lack love in their hearts, but their parents seldom respond and even hurt them again and again. As a result, parents and children hurt each other. Some children are also forced to get involved in adult relationships. , learned violence, alienation and indifference." Li Guihong said.

;

;Feeling the importance of family education, Zhan Danian opened a parent class soon after the school opened. His private account has continued to spread educational concepts at a frequency of two messages a day for many years. Many parents gain spiritual strength from Zhan Danian's official account after their children become depressed, tired of studying, and stop communicating with their parents. Some will send their children here directly. But change does not happen overnight.

;

;He Man, who has a big face and bright eyes, grew up in H City on the border between China and Vietnam. The image that impressed her most about her childhood was that her father took her to school on a motorcycle, while her mother was busy with the beauty salon business at night and sleeping during the day.

;

;When she was transferred to Q City in the fourth grade, her father had no time to take care of her, so he found her old math teacher and paid her to come across town to be a "nanny + tutor".

;

;From sixth grade to second grade, He Manwan changed schools five or six times. "I was the vice-captain of cheerleading at the time and ranked first in running. The boys in the senior class added me on WeChat and QQ, and the girls in the same grade were unhappy with me and called me green tea. The students in the second grade of junior high school threatened me to pay protection money, so I had no choice but to fight for my life. There were a lot of gangsters running towards the back door. The teacher said I wasn't good at studying and wouldn't let anyone else play with me."

;

;She smoked in the corner and was reported. "Actually, everyone smokes, but they only talk about me."

;

;She cried to her father, but it was useless. "You didn't listen to me carefully."

;

;"Where's mom?"

;

;"Mom doesn't even know where my school is or where I live in the first semester of junior high school."

;

;She had swallowed about twenty pills of ibuprofen, all of which she had saved by going to the school infirmary when she had a cold. "I can't even jump off the building. I'm surrounded by railings and have no conditions. I just take medicine. Life is really meaningless. My mother told the teacher that I was obsessed with ghosts and deliberately scared them."

;

;She escaped from school again. open. In the end, he was caught by his parents and locked up in the underground garage of his hometown in H City for a night. "Hit me with a wire, slapped me, choked me, and dragged me to wash my tattoos."

;

;She returned to Q City. I went to work in a mobile phone store and was taken back by my parents. "They just want to take me back. They have not participated in too many of my lives. I just want to escape."

;

;Speaking of which, a girl who took a few days off returned to school. , He Man looked at the gate with a hint of happiness: "Many of our classmates often bring a big bag of plum potato chips, jelly, and pizza for us to eat when they come back from vacation. Some of them will bring a cup of milk tea for everyone in the life class, which is beautiful. ."

;

;In "The Ugly Duckling", Juanjuan asked her to be the monitor; Principal Yang asked her to receive visitors; Xiaoying would comfort her and listen to her. She caught up with the summer camp not long after she came here. "We chatted on the playground from morning to night, and when it got dark, we watched movies and ate barbecue together..." She originally thought that this would be the first time she called her parents after arriving at the "Ugly Duckling". I cried, but ended up laughing the whole time. "I used to be very attached to my ex-boyfriend. Lao Li said that I actually knew nothing about love. Haha. But I really understand. The outside world is unreal. Now I have learned to see people."

;

;Because of the course She fell behind too much, so at the age of 15, she retaken the second grade of junior high school in the "ugly duckling". She was not in a hurry, and slowly began to sympathize with her father who always hated her.

;

;My grandparents’ hometown is not in Yunnan. After decades here, they are still not welcome in the town. Her father, who is over fifty, worked as an accountant in H City in his early years. In He Man's eyes, he is actually the most sensible person in the family.

;

;"He is the most serious person in the family, but when he was a child, even a piece of candy was extravagant. He hated the family and felt it was unfair. He was the one who wiped the mess. So he hoped that I would make a difference. I can stay with you."

;

;Before coming to "The Ugly Duckling", He Man went to Kunming to see a psychiatrist. "The doctor said that the gap between your two generations is too deep. Anyway, my parents don't ask me about many things, and I don't tell them either. Sometimes I am naughty and just want to deliberately anger them." She paused and softened her tone. : "My dad has diabetes, and I won't deliberately anger him anymore."

;

;In Ono's story, she and her mother are almost the only ones.

;

;"Today is the 136th day since I came to Ugly Duckling." As soon as she sat down, she clearly stated the day. Every day that passes, she will cross off a line on her calendar - "It feels like one day closer to going home."

;

;Unlike the other girls who can't wait to share, Ono's eyes and mouth are full of excitement. Take a look at it. She is good at art. Recently, she has contributed to the school's "class culture", from the stairwells to the dormitory walls to the decorative paintings in the corridors. She is good at singing and dancing. But as if that wasn't enough to satisfy her cravings.

;

;"She often hurts herself. She uses rulers, stones, gel pens to break them, and everything else. Her hands and legs are like fish scales." Li Guihong said that Pu Pu's self-mutilation is more of a This is a kind of emotional catharsis, and there is an additional intention of "seeking attention" in Ono's behavior.

;

;In Ono’s description, her mother felt that the divorce was because of her daughter, “so she always resented me with personal emotions.” From an early age, the more her mother did not allow her to do anything, the more she came to The more I want to do it. When they quarreled, the two always used vicious words to accuse each other, "She said I was delusional. I said you should go and have a look, there must be something wrong with you."

;

;Ono used to love giving to her mother Write a letter, write a WeChat, or handwrite a letter of a few hundred words, then take a photo and send it to "Lao Li". "Actually, she wants me to forward it to her mother. Some parents from other provinces may come three or four times. She thinks why her mother never comes. If she doesn't come, she doesn't love me. To realize it immediately is to love me."

;

;"When we grow up, we will send those rebellious parents to a school called 'Ugly Duck', or 'Ugly Chicken', haha!" Speaking of the suggestion when chatting with classmates , Ono shrugged and laughed.

;

;But her mother knows that she wants to buy "Lolita" clothes and loves to go to comic exhibitions, so she will fully support her. "I'm not a qualified daughter...I'm sorry for my mother." Ono's eyes were a little red. She hopes that she will be independent soon and be able to earn money. "I will give money to my mother when I go out."

;

;"My biological father? I haven't seen him. He doesn't want me because I am a girl. Does he want to see me now? No." Maybe."

;

;As for "The Ugly Duckling", she had checked this place before coming here. The name of the school was weird. "Live a happy and complete educational life..." She murmured the school motto "The Ugly Duckling", which was quoted from the educator Zhu Yongxin, "Can it be realized?"

;

;She refused to graduate from the third grade of junior high school. , hoping to leave as soon as possible, because there are a lot of fun things waiting for her outside. In her hometown, she went to KTV in the fourth and fifth grade of elementary school. “Those sisters who added WeChat are so beautiful.” They praised her that “she can sing and dance, can do makeup well, and won’t cause trouble.” Some adults also taught her “don’t care too much.” She found this life philosophy to be insightful and joyful.

;

;She hopes that Lao Li will communicate with her mother and let her go back. But her mother was worried. "In Yiliang, we can cut off social ties between her and her hometown." Li Guihong said that she once gently reminded Ono that people in society are loyal, but small favors may be used to exploit minors. "She is not yet able to listen to these principles, but we have to explain them to her bit by bit."

;

;;

;

;October 21, 2023, the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum Lecture On-site ;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/Photo);

;

;New educational philosophy

;

;With more individuality The story of Pu Pu and Ono, I left the "ugly duckling" who stayed for three days and headed to Kunming. Regarding adolescent depression, various special discussions have long been common, but the popularity of the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum held in Kunming from October 21 to 22 exceeded the organizers’ expectations. Active speakers, from writing notes to grabbing the microphone, to some rushing directly to the side of the stage, have to speak their minds "with offense".

;

;A reader of Zhan Danian said that he had been studying well since childhood and had been attending the best local schools, but he had never been happy or had a sense of accomplishment. He was still confused when he was in his thirties; several teachers and parents brought Children were asked to seek help on-site for school bullying and mental illness problems; several teachers from different schools also suggested that they wanted to care for students, but were unable to do so. “We are also problem teachers, who will help us?!”

;

;“It not only shows that everyone has a huge desire to express themselves and their enthusiasm to solve problems, but also shows that many people, whether they are educators or parents, have psychological problems that need to be seen. Being diverted." One of the guests lamented.

;

;The "Minor Protection Law" revised and implemented in June 2021 clearly stipulates: The education administration department should strengthen the mental health education of minors and establish a mechanism for early detection and timely intervention of minors' psychological problems. .

;

;But inside and outside the forum, people discuss more about real-life problems that cause depression or are caused by depression.

;

;Famous education expert Feng Enhong pointed out that what we face in building a defensive line of psychological safety education for teenagers is the overall loss of education in today's society.

;

;Chen Yu is the founder of the family education platform "Youth is Different". He has conducted in-depth interviews with hundreds of primary and secondary school students who are depressed, tired of studying, struggling and desperate. Among the students who came to her for face-to-face and telephone consultation this year, the number that increased sharply was high school freshmen.

;

;"On the first day of their first year in high school, some children do their homework until 11 o'clock at night. The teacher said, you are already in high school, do you still expect to sleep well? There are Beijing's 'Six Little Strong' (;Haidian Famous School;) students asked me, why do I need to learn to the point of being word for word? This is a confusion of many children. "

;

;A student told Chen Yu that on the first day of school, the school mobilized like this: "If you have grades, you have everything. The classmates sitting next to you are all enemies in the high school entrance examination room." She met I heard about a girl from a prestigious school in Shenzhen who got up to study at 4 a.m. and her period gradually stopped coming. She asked the girl, "Does everything have to give way to grades? Are grades more important than body?"

;

;"The girl said, yes. 'That's good, I don't have to worry about exams hitting my menstrual period anymore' There is also a child who ranks first in grade in Liaoning who feels like he is 'like a thief who stole the emperor's crown', as if he was sitting on a high platform and would fall down if a gust of wind blew." Chen Yu concluded that children of this generation , get tired of studying earlier, take a longer break from studying, and find it more difficult to resume studying.

;

;“All the brilliant achievements of education are meaningless if a child suffers from reduced vision, lack of sleep, weak constitution, mental deformity, or even premature death!” Li Zhenxi exclaimed in his speech.

;

;When students are prone to depression or are diagnosed, they will encounter completely different situations.

;

;A child Chen Yu interviewed was ostracized by his classmates after he was diagnosed with depression, and his desk was filled with garbage and mineral water bottles. Later, the new class teacher invited her out to chat in a cafe. When school resumed, she held the little girl's hand and walked into the school. When she arrived at the door of the class, the whole class applauded to welcome her, and the child's psychology changed drastically.

;

;But in a place in Jiangsu and Zhejiang, a school conducted psychological tests and evaluations for students approaching their third year of high school. "The school said to some of the children that your current emotional state cannot adapt to the school's next studies." Expelled them from school. Many children with depression will also say that no teachers or students have contacted me since I returned home. They feel that I have been abandoned by this organization."

;

;Solution Where is the Tao?

;

;Educator Yang Dongping’s answer is that the education department continues to introduce new policies to “reduce burdens”, but how to get rid of the long-term conflict between educational policies and educational reality, and the lack of vitality in quality education? There is only one answer: China needs a new educational philosophy and a top-down design from scratch.

;

;He further proposed: We should reduce the number of teaching hours from the source, reduce the concentration of teaching and the difficulty of examinations, implement the all-subject teacher model in primary schools, and improve the educational ecology; cancel key schools, pilot subject stratification, and have It facilitates communication among students and reduces labeling or discrimination caused by the educational diversion system.

;

;“When you respect your child as a person and get along with him, you will get a normal and healthy person; if you treat your child as a learning machine, you will get an object. "Yang Dongping's powerful voice and Zhan Danian's simple language aroused strong resonance from the audience.

;

;Readers who visited Ugly Duckling Middle School and read Zhan Danian's account felt that "problem children" found themselves here and got to know life, and they could start anew. "So, can an ordinary school become an 'ugly duckling'? What would happen if normal children were educated in this way?"

;

;However, Zhan Danian has always emphasized that the ugly duckling middle school is a preventive one. Schools provide suitable education methods for children who cannot adapt to the traditional education system, rather than providing a methodology to solve their difficulties. "All the crux of education we encounter today cannot be changed by a forum. But it can provide a way of thinking: Is there something wrong with our teaching and our family education? This is what these discussions and voices can do. Zhan Danian, who seems to be "invincible" in front of others, admits that he is often at a loss when faced with children with depression and other symptoms. There was once a mixed-race girl whose parents separated. One of her toes was wrapped with a rubber band until it became necrotic. Then the "ugly duckling" came and wanted to wrap another toe. I've been here for several months and still haven't looked up, and progress is slow. "We had no choice but to dissuade this child because it was beyond our capabilities and required the intervention of medical institutions." There was a rare sense of loss and powerlessness in Zhan Danian's tone.

;

;I asked Chen Yu, if the school environment is difficult to change and some parents are "stubborn" as the guests said, what advice would she give to the children she interviewed?

;

;"I hope that the status quo of domestic vocational high schools and technical schools will change, so that ordinary people with skills can live a decent life. As long as a child has a little bit of sparkle, he will not be completely Deny yourself."

;

;A mother in Quanzhou once asked her for help: her son's IQ was slightly deficient, and she hoped that the child could keep up with the pace of his classmates' studies, but the child was already tired of studying. Chen Yu learned that the boy liked raising pets very much, "I said you follow me and imagine that on the street where you live, there is a seafood shop opened by your father, a photo studio opened by you, and a flower, bird, fish and insect shop opened by your child. Isn't it wonderful? She said, Teacher Chen, before others advised me to get a 'roll', I was very happy when I heard you say that."

;

;"In the present moment, understand children and the times. It is particularly important. Every child brings his own food, grass and map. We must provide comprehensive support for the children and do not let them look around and feel lonely." Chen Yu used an analogy. "A tutor who understands you, a trustworthy boyfriend/girlfriend, can be a fulcrum." If you are surrounded by people who have no support, I would tell them, stand up, and you will have a chance after you turn 18. Heal yourself and become your own nourisher. ”

;

;Before ending the interview with “The Ugly Duckling”, Pu Pu told me that she hoped to return to that “high-quality and strictly controlled” middle school to take the high school entrance examination because her uncle drove a taxi and was just in the first grade of junior high school. Her cousin has to do homework, take care of her two-year-old little brother, and cook for her uncle. If she grows up and has a good job, "it can make her cousin less hard-working." He Man said that in the past, she and her father We quarreled, and now we talk about it every few days, why didn't dad send a message? Ono, who has been studying Japanese by himself and passed N2, wants to be an illustrator when he grows up, "My mother supports me to study in Japan"; Ji Guoer's mother hopes that she can I went to the police academy, “but I want to be a kindergarten teacher and teach children. Principal Zhan also thinks I can do it. ”

;

;(Reference: Zhan Danian’s private account, guest speaker at the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum. The names of the students in the article are pseudonyms. Intern reporter Yang Yuxi also contributed to this article. )

;

;All the people gathered in this hall, all those who heard our message about Fu Da’s dementia You all have a good relationship because of the word "fate". This good relationship began at an award ceremony more than 20 years ago. My husband and Professor Xin Shiwen, the former dean of Shanheng College, won awards at the same time. Therefore, Dean Xin and I had a close relationship. In 2018, I won the Xin Shiwen Award again. The dean awarded him the title of Honorary Academician of Shanheng College, and he became associated with the Chinese University from then on.

;

;My relationship with Dr. Zhao Xiaying began in the early days of the COVID-19 invasion. I discussed with my friend Jin Shenghua that we wanted to do our best for society in the COVID-19 battle. Shenghua introduced Dr. Lei Zhaohui and Dr. Zhao Xiaying to us. I knew each other and we became friends. During Christmas last year, we had afternoon tea at the Peninsula Hotel and heard Dr. Zhao discussing the Alzheimer's disease project with Shenghua. I thought it was urgent, so I took the initiative to participate in it, hoping to do my best to help promote this project. This charitable act enables people with invisible and mild dementia to prevent and delay their symptoms, alleviate the pain of themselves and their families, and reduce the burden on society. Dr. Zhao introduced me to Dean Mok Zhongtang of Shanheng Academy and Ms. Huang Meiyun (Mrs. Gao Kun), chairman of the Kao Kun Charitable Foundation. We hit it off in all aspects and soon promoted the brain degeneration project, and the good relationship continued from this Go down.

;

;;

;

;Brigitte Lin and Dr. Zhao Xiaying (left), and Dean Mok Chung-tang of Shanheng College of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;After participating in the brain-smart care activity, I went to the hospital with neurologists Dr. Mo and Dr. Zhao After a few classes, I learned a lot of knowledge that I wouldn’t normally have access to. Do you know how much your brain weighs? Three pounds; do you know how many nerve cells there are in the brain? One hundred billion; each nerve cell is connected to thousands of other nerve cells through branches to form a communication network. The connections between these branches exceed one hundred billion points, and the entire connection forms a complex network. Did you know that one in ten people over the age of seventy has dementia? I have many friends who are in their seventies, eighties or nineties and have very bright minds. I like to get close to them. They have rich life experiences and the insights they have gained in life. Those treasures have a lot to learn from, so we must Take good care of the elderly.

;

;Let me tell you an interesting thing. Because I wanted to get close to the 90-year-old former superstar Sister Glenn, I went to watch the Beijing Opera with her. I was also curious about the ticketing of the opera. There were seven theatergoers, three of whom were 90 years old. One of the above, one of whom is ninety-nine years old, does not use crutches, does not use a wheelchair, does not have a caregiver, and walks in alone in a neat suit. Three people over ninety years old sing Peking Opera with amazing energy, and they are not even chatting. They speak freely without any scruples. I really can’t call them Mr. or Mrs. They live a free and easy life. During this time, everyone was joking and paired Sister Glenn and Jiujiu. I thought it was so cute. I raised my camera and shouted, "Kiss me! Kiss me!" Jiujiu generously kissed Sister Glenn on the face, and everyone clapped and applauded. hapiness.

;

;;

;

;As sponsor and project ambassador, Brigitte Lin at the launch ceremony of the "Brain Intelligence Care" service plan. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;I am 68 this year and will be 69 in November. My memory and reaction Better than before I was sixty. I read, write, draw, sing, participate in positive social activities, and keep exercising every day. In addition to hiking, I play table tennis almost every day and occasionally do yoga. I am curious about everything in the world. The most important thing is Cultivating the ability to love is something I rarely did before I was sixty. Now I seem to be living another person's life. Turns out all of these are great remedies for brain degeneration. If sixty returned to zero and started over, I would be only eight years old now.

;

;Having said so much, let’s get back to the subject. I would like to appeal to children over the age of sixty to actively sign up and test whether your brain is still as bright as before. If not, let us work together to fight back Alzheimer’s disease.

;

;(This article is Brigitte Lin’s speech at the launch ceremony of Hong Kong’s “Brain-Smart Care” service plan)

;

;Razor clams are a popular and affordable seafood. In order to increase the production of razor clams, some fishermen illegally use pesticides on the tidal flats to kill and drive away the natural enemies of razor clams on the tidal flats. Visual China|Picture

;

;
;

;

;Liu Ming is still waiting for an explanation.

;

;A few months ago, many of the aquatic products in his fish pond suddenly died overnight, causing heavy losses. His fish pond is close to the seaside. Every time the tide rises on the first and fifteenth day of the lunar month, seawater is introduced into the pond to change the water. Three other farmer neighbors also suffered losses. They all changed the water on July 2, 2023 - the fifteenth day of the fifth lunar month.

;

;Not only fish pond farmers such as Liu Ming are asking for gifts from the sea, but there are also razor clam (commonly known as "razor clam") farmers in the tidal flats one or two kilometers away. Liu Ming and others suspected that razor clam farmers put pesticides on the tidal flats, forming "poisonous water" after high tide. They were introduced into the fish ponds just in time for the water change, poisoning the aquatic products.

;

;Liu Ming said that they have reported the case and there is no investigation result yet.

;

;Different organisms have different constitutions. As long as the appropriate dosage is mastered, pesticides can kill and drive away the natural enemies of razor clams on the tidal flats without affecting the razor clams. Huang Biaowu, a senior experimentalist at the School of Marine Biology of Xiamen Marine Vocational and Technical College who has long studied razor clam cultivation, told Southern Weekend reporters that the method of raising razor clams using pesticides on tidal flats currently exists in some coastal areas of my country.

;

;The most common of these pesticides is triazophos, which is mainly used to control pests in fruit trees, cotton, and food crops. However, it is illegal to use it in razor clam cultivation.

;

;The use of pesticides has increased the survival rate of a single razor clam species, but at the expense of biodiversity. The tidal flats are a transit point for millions of migratory birds around the world, and abundant shellfish are their food. At present, the residues, metabolic patterns and effects of pesticides on human health in razor clams have not been fully studied. Due to the difficulty of supervision and other reasons, this farming method has not been effectively managed in some coastal areas.

;

;Kill natural enemies without poisoning razor clams

;

;Razor clams are a popular affordable seafood. Huang Biaowu told Southern Weekend reporters that there are currently many kinds of razor clams on the market. The razor clams sold are basically aquaculture products, and there are two main methods: pond culture and tidal flat culture.

;

;Early cultured razor clam seedlings were derived from wild seedlings, and wild razor clam seedlings were only produced in Zhejiang and Fujian, with limited quantities. More than ten years ago, after a breakthrough in artificial razor clam breeding technology, large-scale tidal flat farming methods emerged.

;

;
;

;

;;< /p>;

;
;

;

;
;

;

;March 2022, Quanzhou, Fujian. In the morning, taking advantage of the lull in the tide, fishermen go to the tidal flats to salvage wild razor clam seedlings for sale. (Pictures and texts are unrelated) Visual China | Pictures

;

;With the promotion of raising razor clams on tidal flats, beach clearing drugs such as triazophos have also become popular.

;

;The rise and fall of the tide forms an intertidal zone thousands of meters wide, which is a treasure trove of biodiversity. In addition to razor clams, algae, snails, Abundant organisms such as shrimps, crabs, and small fishes also attract birds to feed.

;

;Huang Biaowu explained that when the razor clam seedlings are first released, they cannot penetrate very deep into the soil and can easily become food for other organisms on the tidal flats. In severe cases, razor clam farmers may even lose the seeds. receive. Triazophos can kill crabs, snails, gobies and other natural enemies of razor clams.

;

;There are many considerations in how to use triazophos and other drugs.

;

;Li Cheng, who once raised razor clams on the tidal flats, told Southern Weekend reporters that the traffic problem must be solved first. In the vast tidal flats, there are tens of thousands of acres of razor clam farms as far as the eye can see. If you cannot move with your feet alone, you will immediately fall into the mud. To do this, razor clam farmers ride on a homemade scooter-like tool called a "mud sled." It is a long wooden board with slightly warped ends and a handrail in the middle. The driver can kneel on the board with one leg and push on the ground with the other leg, so that he can slide quickly on the mudflat. Four hundred years ago, it was the "secret weapon" used by the Qi army to defeat Japanese pirates.

;

;The dosage and area of ​​triazophos sprayed on the tidal flats need to be strictly controlled to achieve the purpose of killing natural enemies without poisoning razor clams. The razor clam breeding grounds are similar to field ridges, each about 150 meters wide, and the two stems are about 50 meters apart, making it easy for boating. The razor clam farmer tilts a 50-pound pesticide bucket behind the mud sled and moves forward in a straight line at a constant speed. The pesticide slowly flows out from the small eyes of the bucket, and it travels about 2 kilometers in an hour.

;

;Li Cheng revealed that these triazophos were not purchased from the market. "There are wholesalers who can directly contact them to deliver them to you." The time for spraying pesticides is usually before the spring tide. After the tide rises, the pesticides on the tidal flats will spread with the sea water.

;

;It was this "hidden rule" of farming that made Liu Ming and others suspect that the sudden loss of their fish pond after the water change was related to the use of pesticides to raise razor clams. This is not the first time similar incidents have occurred locally. Farmers have even summed up their experience. Before changing the water, they first ask the people at the beach if they find dead fish to judge whether the sea water is "toxic".

;

;Local razor clam seedlings are sown in March and harvested in March of the following year. Because when the weather gets colder, there are fewer natural enemies of razor clams near the shore, so the spraying time lasts from March to September, usually at most twice a month. "The smell of triazophos is very pungent and very irritating." Li Cheng said that once he put triazophos in the car, and the unpleasant smell did not dissipate for several days.

;

;According to media reports, in 2018, Lao Wang, who had been raising razor clams for 18 years in Dafeng, Yancheng, Jiangsu, suddenly developed chest tightness, dizziness, and fatigue. Doctors found that the culprit was Lao Wang. The organophosphorus pesticide used by Wang can kill cockroaches (a small organism commonly known as "sea leather") that destroy the growing environment of razor clams.

;

;In addition to triazophos, Li Cheng also used two pesticides, dichlorvos and imidacloprid, which were also used to kill the natural enemies of razor clams, but triazophos was used in the largest amount. .

;

;Explicitly prohibited but difficult to supervise

;

;Pesticides such as triazophos, dichlorvos and imidacloprid are not used in aquaculture in compliance with regulations.

;

;An expert in the field of aquatic products and fishery drugs said in an interview with a reporter from Southern Weekend that my country implements a white list system for aquaculture drugs. “The veterinary drugs for aquaculture in the white list have all undergone rigorous research on pharmacodynamics, toxicology, food safety and environmental impact, and have a relatively in-depth understanding of the effects of use and the rules of metabolic residues in aquatic products. Know."

;

;Chemical drugs outside the white list are not allowed to be used illegally. Pesticides such as triazophos used by razor clam farmers are not on the white list.

;

;There have been some studies on triazophos. An article published in 2007 by experts from the Zhejiang Provincial Institute of Marine Fisheries and other institutions mentioned that triazophos used in the process of raising razor clams can remain in edible tissues. Experimental simulation data shows that triazophos is present in razor clams. The accumulation and elimination speed in the drug are both fast. 24 hours after the drug was administered, the concentration of triazophos in the body reached 2.97mg/kg, and after 100 hours, it dropped to 0.021mg/kg.

;

;Currently, my country has only set limits for triazophos in plant foods, and there is no standard to follow in aquatic products. Referring to the "National Food Safety Standard Maximum Residue Limits of Pesticides in Food" (GB 2763-2021), the maximum limit is 0.2mg/kg for fruits, and the minimum limit is 0.05mg/kg for cereals such as wheat and oats. The 24-hour data of the above study seriously exceeded the standard, but the 100-hour data did not exceed the standard.

;

;However, because triazophos can easily cause excessive pesticide residues in vegetables, triazophos is not popular in vegetable planting. In 2013, the former Ministry of Rural Affairs stipulated that, Its use on vegetables is prohibited after December 31, 2016.

;

;Some places have clearly banned the use of triazophos for raising razor clams. For example, in 2017, Yueqing City, Zhejiang Province, one of the main producing areas of wild razor clam seedlings, issued the "Notice on Prohibiting the Use of Pesticides in Shallow Beach Breeding", which strictly prohibited the use of triazophos, dichlorvos, sodium pentachlorophenol, and cypermethrin in shallow beach breeding. , imidacloprid and other pesticides, and residents are encouraged to stop and report violations.

;

;There are also cases of punishment. In 2017, law enforcement officers from the Ninghai County Fishery Administration and Fishing Port Supervision and Management Station in Ningbo, Zhejiang Province discovered that someone was using triazophos during the cultivation of razor clams and were fined 10,000 yuan.

;

;However, it is very difficult to regulate the use of pesticides such as triazophos. Some coastal farmers told Southern Weekend reporters that this breeding method has been secretive for many years. To avoid public notice, razor clam farmers usually spray pesticides late at night.

;

;As early as 2014, Wang Songlin, chairman of the environmental organization "Qingdao Marine Ecology Research Association", witnessed a group of razor clam farmers spreading triazophos on the tidal flats. The "Razor Clam: China Offshore Breeding Assessment Report" released by the Research Association in 2019 pointed out that the inconvenient transportation into the breeding tidal flat wetlands has brought many difficulties to supervision work. For example, people, vehicles, and ships cannot move forward on the muddy tidal flats, making it difficult for supervisors to locate evidence.

;Inertial thinking in farmland management

;

;Wang Songlin said that not only razor clams, but also some economical shellfish For example, the tidal flat cultivation of variegated clams and the large-scale sea cucumber cofferdam breeding industry along the Yellow and Bohai Seas also have illegal use of chemicals.

;

;The "Sea Cucumber: China Offshore Pond and Cofferdam Culture Assessment Report" released by the Qingdao Marine Ecology Research Association in 2019 mentioned that the cofferdam culture of sea cucumbers is abused The chemical problem is more serious. For example, in order to prevent and treat diseases, antibiotics are used illegally in the nursery stage; pesticides and herbicides are illegally used in the breeding process to clear ponds and kill sea cucumbers' natural enemies; excessive amounts of alum and illegal use of formaldehyde may also be used in the processing and sales of sea cucumbers. , causing the aluminum content and formaldehyde in sea cucumbers to exceed standards.

;

;Raising razor clams on tidal flats not only destroys biodiversity through the use of pesticides, but also causes the death of birds by erecting anti-bird nets. A newly published study by Princeton University associate researcher Liang Dan and others found that during the peak spring migration period of migratory birds in April and May 2021, anti-bird nets erected for razor clam farming in Xinghua Bay, Fujian and Yueqing Bay, Zhejiang More than 13,000 shorebirds were trapped, many of which are nationally protected species. The research team also found similar anti-bird nets in 17 other locations in Zhejiang and Fujian.

;

;Liang Dan told Southern Weekend reporters that the above-mentioned tidal flats in the above two places specialize in breeding razor clam seedlings. The razor clam seedlings usually sprout from around November and grow until March or March of the following year. It can be harvested in April. If these bird-proof nets are removed immediately after razor clam seedlings are harvested in March and April, tens of thousands of birds migrating in spring can be saved, and part of the bird-proof nets can also be prevented from entering the sea and harming marine life. However, because it requires high labor costs to dismantle the nets on the tidal flats, the farmers will keep the nets on the tidal flats after selling the razor clam seedlings, waiting until typhoons to sweep away the nets in June or July.

;

;In their natural state, razor clams are only part of the biodiversity of Hamada Wetland. To carry out aquaculture on legally protected natural tidal wetlands, Wang Songlin believes that fishermen have to accept the high natural mortality rate of razor clams - being predated by natural enemies and competing with other benthic animals.

;

;But it’s hard. Whether it is razor clams or sea cucumbers, the use of banned chemicals such as organophosphorus and pyrethroid pesticides in the breeding process reflects the farmers' inertial thinking: managing natural tidal flats and coastal zones as farmland, and treating aquaculture products as a single type of " crop". "I asked an old couple who came back from spraying pesticides. They were very enthusiastic and said frankly that the beach is no different from a cotton field. To ensure a high yield of razor clams, other fish, shrimps, crabs, and shellfish must be killed with pesticides, and long-billed waterfowl must be driven away." Wang Songlin said.

;

;There is an old saying: "April razor clams are plump and plump, so don't let Xishi's tongue down." April is the most plump season for razor clams, but it is not an eco-friendly time to eat them. . Because spring and autumn are also the peak seasons for migratory birds, reducing the interference from human activities such as spraying pesticides to clear the beach and firing cannons to drive away birds on natural tidal wetlands is of great significance to ecological protection.

;

;How to resolve these contradictions, Yueqing City, Zhejiang Province advocates the use of boat cultivators, quicklime, bleaching powder, drying and other methods to clear beaches and ponds.

;

;Huang Biaowu suggested that farmers return to the old method of pond farming. For pond culture, eco-friendly quicklime and Chinese medicinal materials can be used instead of triazophos in clear ponds. Raising razor clams in ponds requires fertilizer and water, which is equivalent to fertilizing crops. Raising razor clams in ponds can also use the tail water discharged from other fish ponds as fertilizer water to purify the organic matter rich in nitrogen, phosphorus and other organic matter in the tail water, turning waste into treasure.
